Key.Original:
The Wildcat AH11 is a British multi-purpose military helicopter, designed to serve in battlefield utility, search and rescue and anti-submarine warfare roles.
The AH11 is armed with the CRV7 rocket system and with the M621 20mm automatic cannon.
Key.English:
The Wildcat AH11 is a British multi-purpose military helicopter, designed to serve in battlefield utility, search and rescue and anti-submarine warfare roles.
The AH11 is armed with the CRV7 rocket system and with the M621 20mm automatic cannon.

Key.Original:
The Apache AH Mk1 is a licence-built version of the AH-64D Apache Longbow attack helicopter for the British Army. It is a four-blade, two-seat, twin-engine attack helicopter.
The Apache is armed with a 30mm M230 Chain Gun and with AGM-114 Hellfire and Hydra 70 rocket pods.
Key.English:
The Apache AH Mk1 is a licence-built version of the AH-64D Apache Longbow attack helicopter for the British Army. It is a four-blade, two-seat, twin-engine attack helicopter.
The Apache is armed with a 30mm M230 Chain Gun and with AGM-114 Hellfire and Hydra 70 rocket pods.

Key.Original:
The Merlin HC3 is a British designation for a AW101 medium-lift transport helicopter.
The Merlin HC3 has a maximal speed of 309 km/h and the operational range of 1380 km.
Key.English:
The Merlin HC3 is a British designation for a AW101 medium-lift transport helicopter.
The Merlin HC3 has a maximal speed of 309 km/h and the operational range of 1380 km.

Key.Original:
The Chinook HC4 is a British designation for a CH-47 Chinook. It is a versatile, twin-engine, tandem rotor heavy-lift helicopter.
The main use of Chinook HC4 includes troop movement, artillery emplacement and battlefield resupply.
Key.English:
The Chinook HC4 is a British designation for a CH-47 Chinook. It is a versatile, twin-engine, tandem rotor heavy-lift helicopter.
The main use of Chinook HC4 includes troop movement, artillery emplacement and battlefield resupply.

Key.Original:
The FV510 Warrior is an armoured tracked vehicle used by the British army. It's role is to carry troops under protection to the objective and give firepower support once they have disembarked.
The Warrior is armed with a 40mm CTWS cannon and the L94A1 7.62mm chain gun.
Key.English:
The FV510 Warrior is an armoured tracked vehicle used by the British army. It's role is to carry troops under protection to the objective and give firepower support once they have disembarked.
The Warrior is armed with a 40mm CTWS cannon and the L94A1 7.62mm chain gun.

Key.Original:
The L134A1 is a British designation for a Heckler & Koch GMG automatic grenade launcher. It fires 40mm grenades at a rate of about 350 rounds per minute and can be used for accurate, long range bombardment.
This weapon features the ACOG (Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight).
Key.English:
The L134A1 is a British designation for a Heckler & Koch GMG automatic grenade launcher. It fires 40mm grenades at a rate of about 350 rounds per minute and can be used for accurate, long range bombardment.
This weapon features the ACOG (Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight).

Key.Original:
The L7A2 is a British designation for a Belgian 7.62mm belt- fed general purpose machine gun FN MAG. It can be carried by foot soldiers and employed as a light machine gun. It is used mainly by para and marines these days.
This weapon features the Elcan C79 opical sights.
Key.English:
The L7A2 is a British designation for a Belgian 7.62mm belt- fed general purpose machine gun FN MAG. It can be carried by foot soldiers and employed as a light machine gun. It is used mainly by para and marines these days.
This weapon features the Elcan C79 opical sights.

Key.Original:
The L111A1 is a British designation for the M2 .50 caliber Machine Gun. It is a very versatile weapon which be used effectively against infantry, light armoured vehicles, slow flying aircraft and small boats.
This weapon features the ACOG (Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight).
Key.English:
The L111A1 is a British designation for the M2 .50 caliber Machine Gun. It is a very versatile weapon which be used effectively against infantry, light armoured vehicles, slow flying aircraft and small boats.
This weapon features the ACOG (Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight).

Key.Original:
The L111A1 is a British designation for the M2 .50 caliber Machine Gun. It is a very versatile weapon which be used effectively against infantry, light armoured vehicles, slow flying aircraft and small boats.
This weapon features the ACOG (Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight).
Key.English:
The L111A1 is a British designation for the M2 .50 caliber Machine Gun. It is a very versatile weapon which be used effectively against infantry, light armoured vehicles, slow flying aircraft and small boats.
This weapon features the ACOG (Advanced Combat Optical Gunsight).

Key.Original:
The AS50 is a .50 BMG sniper/anti-materiel rifle. It enables operators to engage targets at very long range (up to 1500 m) with high accuracy.
This weapon is prized highly for being transportable, ergonomic and lightweight. It can be disassembled in less than three minutes and serviced without tools.
Key.English:
The AS50 is a .50 BMG sniper/anti-materiel rifle. It enables operators to engage targets at very long range (up to 1500 m) with high accuracy.
This weapon is prized highly for being transportable, ergonomic and lightweight. It can be disassembled in less than three minutes and serviced without tools.

Key.Original:
The AS50 is a .50 BMG sniper/anti-materiel rifle. It enables operators to engage targets at very long (up to 1500 m) range with high accuracy.
This rifle features an additional TWS (Thermal Weapons Sights).
Key.English:
The AS50 is a .50 BMG sniper/anti-materiel rifle. It enables operators to engage targets at very long (up to 1500 m) range with high accuracy.
This rifle features an additional TWS (Thermal Weapons Sights).

Key.Original:
The L110A1 is a British designation for a Belgian 5.56mm light machine gun Minimi Para. It is an air-cooled weapon, capable only of fully automatic fire, and it is adjusted to be used as paratroopers weapon.
This rifle features the red-dot Aimpoint gunsight and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.
Key.English:
The L110A1 is a British designation for a Belgian 5.56mm light machine gun Minimi Para. It is an air-cooled weapon, capable only of fully automatic fire, and it is adjusted to be used as paratroopers weapon.
This rifle features the red-dot Aimpoint gunsight and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.

Key.Original: The L7A2 is a British designation for a Belgian 7.62 mm belt- fed general purpose machine gun FN MAG. It can be carried by foot soldiers and employed as a light machine gun. It is used mainly by para and marines these days.
Key.English: The L7A2 is a British designation for a Belgian 7.62 mm belt- fed general purpose machine gun FN MAG. It can be carried by foot soldiers and employed as a light machine gun. It is used mainly by para and marines these days.

Key.Original:
The L85A2 is a standard weapon of the British Armed Forces, which replaced the previous weapon, the L85A1 (SA80). The new version has many improvements, and it no longer jams easily. On other hand, A2 is slightly heavier that A1.
This rifle features the ACOG, the RIS (rail interface system) and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.
Key.English:
The L85A2 is a standard weapon of the British Armed Forces, which replaced the previous weapon, the L85A1 (SA80). The new version has many improvements, and it no longer jams easily. On other hand, A2 is slightly heavier that A1.
This rifle features the ACOG, the RIS (rail interface system) and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.

Key.Original:
The L85A2 is a standard weapon of the British Armed Forces, which replaced the previous weapon, the L85A1 (SA80). The new version has many improvements, and it no longer jams easily. On other hand, A2 is slightly heavier that A1.
This rifle features AWS fourth generation sights and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.

Key.Original:
The L85A2 is a standard weapon of the British Armed Forces, which replaced the previous weapon, the L85A1 (SA80). The new version has many improvements, and it no longer jams easily. On other hand, A2 is slightly heavier that A1.
This rifle features the EOTech holographic sights, the RIS (rail interface system) and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.

Key.Original:
The L85A2 is a standard weapon of the British Armed Forces, which replaced the previous weapon, the L85A1 (SA80). The new version has many improvements, and it no longer jams easily. On other hand, A2 is slightly heavier that A1.
This rifle features the SUSAT (4x optical sights), the RIS (rail interface system) and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.
Key.English:

Key.Original:

This rifle features the ACOG, the UGL (Under-slung Grenade Launcher) and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.

Caliber: 5.56x45 mm NATO

Key.Original:
The L86A1 LSW is the variant of the L85 rifle, but features longer barrel than the L85A1 rifle, which gives it a greater effective range. This rifle was intended to provide fire support at a fireteam level.
This rifle features the ACOG (Advancet Combat Optical Gunsight).
Key.English:
The L86A1 LSW is the variant of the L85 rifle, but features longer barrel than the L85A1 rifle, which gives it a greater effective range. This rifle was intended to provide fire support at a fireteam level.
This rifle features the ACOG (Advancet Combat Optical Gunsight).

Key.Original:
The L115A1 Long Range Rifle (LRR) is a British designation for a AWSM (Arctic Warfare Super Magnum) sniper rifle. It is highly prized as a dedicated long range sniper rifle that combines the manoeuvrability with the great power and range.
This rifle features the red-dot Aimpoint gunsight and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.
Key.English:
The L115A1 Long Range Rifle (LRR) is a British designation for a AWSM (Arctic Warfare Super Magnum) sniper rifle. It is highly prized as a dedicated long range sniper rifle that combines the manoeuvrability with the great power and range.
This rifle features the red-dot Aimpoint gunsight and the AN/PEQ-2 laser sights.

Key.Original: The NLAW (Next Generation Light Armor Weapon) is the portable, short range, fire-and-forget anti-tank guided missile system. It features a soft-launch system, allowing it to be used from within an enclosed room.
Key.English: The NLAW (Next Generation Light Armor Weapon) is the portable, short range, fire-and-forget anti-tank guided missile system. It features a soft-launch system, allowing it to be used from within an enclosed room.

Key.Original:
The Jackal or MWMIK (Mobility Weapon-Mounted Installation Kit) is a combat vehicle used by the British Army. The primary role of ths vehicle is deep battlespace reconnaissance, rapid assault and fire support.
Jackal 2 is an updated version with increased survivability. This one is armed with the L134A1 grenade machine gun.
Key.English:
The Jackal or MWMIK (Mobility Weapon-Mounted Installation Kit) is a combat vehicle used by the British Army. The primary role of ths vehicle is deep battlespace reconnaissance, rapid assault and fire support.
Jackal 2 is an updated version with increased survivability. This one is armed with the L134A1 grenade machine gun.

Key.Original:
The Jackal or MWMIK (Mobility Weapon-Mounted Installation Kit) is a combat vehicle used by the British Army. The primary role of ths vehicle is deep battlespace reconnaissance, rapid assault and fire support.
Jackal 2 is an updated version with increased survivability. This one is armed with the L111A1 .50 caliber machine gun.
Key.English:
The Jackal or MWMIK (Mobility Weapon-Mounted Installation Kit) is a combat vehicle used by the British Army. The primary role of ths vehicle is deep battlespace reconnaissance, rapid assault and fire support.

Key.Original: The offrodads where pioneering the civilian all-terrain utility vehicles, which where introduced in 1948; but later, the mark was adopted as a general brand for many four-wheel drive all-terrain vehicles.
Key.English: The offrodads where pioneering the civilian all-terrain utility vehicles, which where introduced in 1948; but later, the mark was adopted as a general brand for many four-wheel drive all-terrain vehicles.
